1. Follow after charity, and desire spiritual dona gratiae, lest by any means I should come to you and punish you with severitas,
2. And lest I be found to you as a ferreus vir, and lest I should use auctoritas to those that are pueri in Christ.
3. For though I be absent in corpore, yet am I with you spiritu, and I behold your conversatio, and your sollicitudo in Christo Iesus.
4. I write not these things to confundere you, but as filii mei dilecti, and to admonish you.
5. For I would that all men were even as my selfe: but every man hath suum donum a Deo, unus sic, et alius sic.
6. Now brethren, if I come unto you speaking linguae, what shall I profit you, except I shall speak to you either by revelatio, or by scientia, or by prophetia, or by doctrina?
7. And even things without anima, whether flute or harpe, except they give a distinction in the sonis, how shall it be known what is played or harped?
8. For if the tuba give an incertus sonus, who shall prepare himselfe to the proelium?
9. So likewise you, except ye utter by the lingua wordes facile intellectus, how shall it be known what is spoken? for ye shall speak in aer.
10. There are, it may be, so many genera vocum in the mundo, and none of them is sine significatione.
11. Therefore if I know not the potentiam vocis, I shall be unto him that speaketh a barbarus, and he that speaketh shall be a barbarus unto me.
12. Even so ye, forasmuch as ye are zelantes spirituum, seek that ye may abound to the aedificatio of the Ecclesia.
13. Wherefore let him that speaketh in lingua, pray that he may interpretare.
14. For if I pray in lingua, my spiritus prayeth, but my mens is sine fructu.
15. What is it then? I will pray with the spiritus, and I will pray with the mens also: I will cantare with the spiritus, and I will cantare with the mens also.
16. Else when thou shalt bless with the spiritus, how shall he that occupat locum idiotae say Amen at thy gratia, seeing he understandeth not what thou sayest?
17. For thou verily givest gratias wel, but the other is not aedificatus.
18. I thank God, I speak in lingua plus quam vos omnes: yet in Ecclesia, I would rather speak V verba cum sensu, to teach alios, then Mila verba sine sensu.
19. Brethren, be not pueri in sapientia, sed in malitia sitis infantes: but in sapientia sitis perfecti.
20. In malitia fuate sapore mici as col and haudi sem en simom ut sint childim me ed intomin ses timunt ci le apuse phini no end do opioo su intom oomn ormul.
21. In Lege scriptum est, Quia in aliis linguis, et in labiis aliorum loquar populo huic, et tamen haec non audient me, dicit Dominus.
22. Wherefore the linguae are for a signum, not to the fideles, but to the infideles: but prophetia non fidelibus, sed infidelibus.
23. If therefore the whole Ecclesia come together into one locum, and all speak in linguis, and there come in qui sunt idioatae, or qui sunt infideles, will they not say that ye are furiosi?
24. But if all prophetae, and all you speak in linguis, and there come in one qui sit infidelis, or qui sit idiota, he is convictus of all, he is judicatus of all:
25. And thus are the corda occulta manifesta, and so, falling flat on his faciem, he will adore Deum, saying that God is vere in vobis.

26. How is it then, brethren? when ye come together, every one of you hath a Psalmus, hath a doctrinam, hath a lingua, hath a revelatio, hath an interpretatio. Let all things be done to the aedificatio.
27. If any speak in lingua, let it be by duo, or ad plus tres, and that by vicissim: and let one interpretare:
28. And if there be no interpretatio, let him be silent in Ecclesia, and speak to himselfe and to Deus.
29. Let duo, or tres prophetae, loquantur, et duo, aut tres interpretes: sed si alius extiterit qui prophetet, primus taceat.
30. For ye may all prophetae, one by one; that all may discere, and all may consolari.
31. For the spiritus prophetarum subditus est prophetis.
32. Deus non est Deus luctus, sed pacis. Sicut in omnibus Ecclesiis sanctorum,
33. Mulieres in Ecclesiis taceant, quia non permittitur eis loqui: sed subditae sint, sicut et Lex dicit.
34. Sin autem volent discere quidquam, domestis suis interroget virum,

35. quia non licet eis loqui.
